descendants.content: @HumanServitor @gerrymcgovern @breadandcircuses They should have broken out "fundamental changes to society, politics, and economics". What's most needed is the political will to change the economics of the energy industry. Democratizing energy can get us to where we need to be--renewably--if we break the energy monopolies. "The ubiquitous nature of renewable energy calls for a decentralized energy approach." And, importantly, decentralized ownership. #FeedInTariffs

account.note: Professional fine art photographer & art framer. All photos edited using Darktable on a Linux box & licensed Creative Commons BY-SA 4.0. I do not use machine learning apps. Any composites will be clearly noted. Mostly following science, history, & photography toots. Formerly, I was a civil rights & energy policy troublemaker. Also, former netcast producer & host for the Plug In America Show, This Week in Energy, & an occasional show for Hacker Public Radio.

account.note:
Chiant comme un meeting du PSU des années 70. Franchement gonflant avec mes postures permanentes.

Toxic idealist. Moral narcissist. Russian troll farm and maga agent provocateur.

But you know what? I'm happy.

If you want to follow me, follow me.

If you want to block me, block me.

If you want to ping me to tell me you're blocking me, ping me to tell me you're blocking me, but the joke's on you.

descendants.content: @StarkRG @breadandcircuses Yes - & no. We have rather less agency over social change than you suppose. Society isn't some machine that can be fixed if it goes wrong, like a car. There are many things wrong with our societies (plural) for a start; & they are too organic & complex for any mechanistic analogy to hold. Furthermore, we're part of them, & we're part of the problem. We can't abstract ourselves from our societies & treat them with genuine objectivity.

account.note: I am a retired academic, with an MA & PhD in Social Policy & Administration from the Universities of York & Kent respectively. I am disabled, & am deeply concerned about human, gay and disability rights, the climate emergency and the biodiversity crisis. I am currently politically homeless. I like films, classical music, jazz, and reading.

descendants.content: @StarkRG If you want to change society, perhaps you need to think about how society changes, & what sort of change is possible, as well as what change(s) you think might be desirable. That requires knowledge of history, sociology, politics & economics. Oh, & ecology, too! That one's a must.

account.note:
🌏 Born at 312 PPM

Retired NGO executive doing my best to stay informed and raise awareness about environmental crises, climate breakdown, and the rapacious, murderous impact of greedy capitalists and the politicians they own.

Why the name? Back in the day, empires placated their citizens with "bread and circuses." Now we get fast food and apps. But it's all basically the same — distraction from what's REALLY happening.
